inclusion.criterion: Women with histologically proven invasive breast cancer and no distant metastases
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Lymphnode negative and a clinical tumor classification of T2 (≥3.5cm)-T4 or with 1-3 positive lymph nodes and a clinical tumor classification of T2-T4 DCIS or LCIS are allowed in addition to invasive cancer at T2 or T3 level.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: At least one lesion that can be accurately measured in two dimensions utilizing mammogram, ultrasound, or MRI images to define specific size and validate complete pathologic response.
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Adequate bone marrow reserves (neutrophil count >1.5 x10^9 /l and platelet count >100 x10^9/l)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Adequate renal function (serum creatinine ≤ 1.5 x upper limit of normal)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Hepatic function (ALAT, ASAT ≤ 2.5 x upper limit of normal, alkaline phosphatase ≤ 2.5 x upper limit of normal and total bilirubin ≤ 2.0 x upper limit of normal)
inclusion.label: met

inclusion.criterion: Signed informed consent of the patient
inclusion.label: met

exclusion.criterion: Any patient with confirmed metastatic disease.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Tumor sample shipped to Agendia with ≤ 30% tumor cells or that fails Quality Assurance or Quality Control criteria.
exclusion.label: unknown

exclusion.criterion: Patients who have had any prior chemotherapy, radiotherapy, or endocrine therapy for the treatment of breast cancer.
exclusion.label: not_met

exclusion.criterion: Any serious uncontrolled intercurrent infections, or other serious uncontrolled concomitant disease.
exclusion.label: unknown

notes: Patient is a 42 year-old postmenopausal woman with histologically proven invasive breast cancer and no distant metastases. She has adequate bone marrow reserves, renal function, and hepatic function.
